design_used: SRS assumed after scanning all 718 headers for 'weight/strata/cluster' (none found beyond the literal body-weight question).
srs_justification: Higher parental emotional abuse ages 0-12 (mds78zu) predicts higher adult self-reported depression (wz901dj). Likert polarity now aligned via `scripts/likert_utils.py`, and Loop 005 locks the confirmatory family onto the moderation contrasts documented in `tables/loop004_h1_diagnostics.csv` + `tables/loop005_h1_simple_slopes.csv`: (a) the abuse × childhood-guidance buffering coefficient (`abuse_child_guidance_int` > 0) and (b) the abuse × male interaction (`abuse_child_male_int` < 0). Main-effect contrasts remain exploratory until the PAP is frozen.

srs_justification: More parental guidance ages 0-12 (pqo6jmj) associates with higher adult self-love scores (2l8994l); aligned z-scores ensure higher values mean more guidance/self-love.

srs_justification: Respondents from higher childhood socioeconomic class (classchild) report higher current net worth (networth) when modeled via ordered logits across all 10 brackets.
